definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea

sentences.english: I discovered natural horsemanship, a method of training that focuses on communication.
sentences.chinese: 後來，我發現簡單自然的馬術是把交流作爲中心的。

sentences.english: In an equestrian community you get to have your cake and eat it too.
sentences.chinese: 在這樣的馬術社區，你可以魚與熊掌兼得。

sentences.english: Where will the Guangzhou Asian Games’ Equestrian competition take place?
sentences.chinese: 廣州亞運會馬術比賽將在哪兒舉辦？

sentences.english: Take your horse through the equestrian challenge line initially at a canter.
sentences.chinese: 通過採取馬術挑戰你的馬行最初在跑步。

sentences.english: Jennie was very complimentary about Catherine's riding.
sentences.chinese: 詹妮對凱瑟琳的馬術很欣賞。

sentences.english: She is proud of her horsemanship.
sentences.chinese: 她爲自己的馬術感到自豪。

sentences.english: Horsemanship is an art of riding and handling a horse, and includes diverse styles.
sentences.chinese: 馬術是騎馬和馴馬的藝術，包括不同風格。

sentences.english: He had entered a three-day horse riding competition there.
sentences.chinese: 他參加了一項爲期三天的馬術比賽。

sentences.english: Shenzhen has 56 quite big horse- ridings clubs.
sentences.chinese: 深圳有五六家比較大的馬術俱樂部。

sentences.english: Remember the stable with the horse ride?
sentences.chinese: 還記得那個馬術廣告和養馬場嗎？

sentences.english: This game is called the ' pearl ' on imperial crown in current equestrianism sports.
sentences.chinese: 該項運動在當今馬術運動中被譽爲皇冠上的“明珠”。

sentences.english: I loved horses as a child and was a junior show jumper.
sentences.chinese: 我從小就愛馬，曾是一名青少年馬術障礙賽選手。

sentences.english: John could horse-back ride with the best of them, but he never boasted about it.
sentences.chinese: 約翰的馬術不下於任何人，但他從不誇口。

sentences.english: Classical horsemanship seems to have endured in Portugal without many modifications.
sentences.chinese: 古典馬術似乎沒有在葡萄牙經歷許多修改。

definition: to fight, esp. with hands/wrestling (as a sport)/to wrestle/to wrestle (against fate, with a problem etc)/to capture prey
peak/apex/world best/number one/finest (competitors)/top (figures in a certain field)
